The result was a fundamentally critical essay that demolished the horrible political methods that have since then been called machiavellian. The author conceptually changes the reason d'etre for state from brutal and cold machine dedicated to elevate only the power elite to being a more humane organism. One can easily see outright revolutionary ideas burried deep in this highly philosophical discussion that among others deal with establishing a system of religious tolerance and defines the king as a servant of the state and not a tyrannt over the population. Although written hundreds of years ago, the ideas presented are more than interesting today as we are confronted by politicians that use machiavellian methods all the time without any regard for humanity. 40 pages.
